comment_pub_stat: Encourages authors to consult the APS editorial.

Journal name: american journal of physiology-lung cellular and molecular physiology
comment_prereg_trial: If clinical trials were used, a statement of registration is required - not sure if this is enough?
comment_mean: Advances in Physiology Education supports adherence of two of the 2004 Guidelines for Reporting Statistics:  Guideline 5. Report variability using a standard deviation. If the standard deviation is not a meaningful estimate of variability, as when the data are skewed, then the range or interquartile range provide more meaningful estimates
comment_fig_raw_data: Authors are strongly encouraged to present graphical data in a format that shows the range of data points in relation to the mean value and significance (i.e. dot-whisker plots) rather than formats that may mask the variability (i.e. bar graphs).
comment_pub_data: Provide the experimental data and results as well as the particular statistical significance of the data.     To facilitate better reporting of information and data that are auxiliary or ancillary to the main content of the article, data supplements must now be deposited in generalist public access data repository if no community resource is available
comment_pub_proc: 1.	Upon submission of a paper reporting computer simulation using original, author-generated code, authors are encouraged to deposit software and code via a public repository, such as GitHub, if not already deposited to a public repository
inconsistent_txt: Some instructions "encourage" authors to deposit data in repositories while further down in the instructions it states you "must" deposit them. Unclear if it is an "encourage" or "mandate"?    Encouraged authors to consult the APS editorial.

comment_prereg_trial: MDPI follows the International Committee of Medical Journal Editors (ICMJE) guidelines which require and recommend registration of clinical trials in a public trials registry at or before the time of first patient enrollment as a condition of consideration for publication.

Journal name: canadian journal of physiology and pharmacology
comment_pval: 'The assumptions and (or) the model underlying any statistical analysis should be clearly stated. Do not use symbols such as * and ** to denote levels of significance unless accompanied by actual p values.'
comment_pub_data: Mentioned but weak:  'Supply a data availability statement that says WHETHER the data underpinning the work are available. If yes, specify how data can be accessed and under what conditions data can be reused. Supply repository name, persistent unique identifier ...'
comment_pub_stat: NOTE re first section: authors told to go to Equator. 'Study reporting guidelines can help authors report their work transparently and accurately. We encourage their use. Up-to-date guidelines can be found at the EQUATOR Network, where authors can consult the flow chart or wizard to identify which guideline(s) to use. A completed copy of the guideline checklist may be submitted with the manuscript as a Supplementary file.'

comment_pub_proc: Upon request authors should be prepared to send relevant documentation or data

Journal name: clinical and experimental pharmacology and physiology
comment_alpha: The level of statistical significance (alpha) should be defined and it should be stated explicitly whether this refers to one- or two-sided probability. Nevertheless, exact P values should be given to a sensible number of significant figures (e.g. P = 0.01 rather than P = 0.0058). The risk of type 1 error (a false positive inference) should always be controlled.
comment_mean: Data should be expressed as mean (SD) when the intention is to indicate the degree of variability of the data around the mean value, and as mean ± SEM when the intention is to estimate the population mean from the sample data. In either case, the numbers of observations (n) should be stipulated. This allows the reader to calculate SD from SEM and vice versa.
comment_no_sem: Data should be expressed as mean (SD) when the intention is to indicate the degree of variability of the data around the mean value, and as mean ± SEM when the intention is to estimate the population mean from the sample data. In either case, the numbers of observations (n) should be stipulated. This allows the reader to calculate SD from SEM and vice versa.
comment_pub_data: Note: if data, scripts, or other artefacts used to generate the analyses presented in the paper are available via a publicly available data repository, authors should include a reference to the location of the material within their paper.    The journal encourages authors to share the data and other artefacts supporting the results in the paper by archiving it in an appropriate public repository. Authors should include a data accessibility statement, including a link to the repository they have used, in order that this statement can be published alongside their paper.
comment_pub_proc: Note: if data, scripts, or other artefacts used to generate the analyses presented in the paper are available via a publicly available data repository, authors should include a reference to the location of the material within their paper.
comment_pub_stat: Note: if data, scripts, or other artefacts used to generate the analyses presented in the paper are available via a publicly available data repository, authors should include a reference to the location of the material within their paper.

comment_var: Transparent reporting also requires the authors to specify the spread of group data.
comment_mean: In case of normal distribution, any mean value a should be reported together with a measure b which reflects the spread around the mean (a ± b). It should be clarified whether b equals standard deviation (to provide information about dispersion around the mean) or standard error (to provide information about precision of sampling estimation).
comment_pub_data: Clinical Neurophysiology offers Supplementary Material, where background or auxiliary data sets and their statistical analyses could be published to maintain reading flow of the core results in the main text.
comment_pub_proc: To facilitate reproducibility and data reuse, this journal also encourages you to share your software, code, models, algorithms, protocols, methods and other useful materials related to the project.

inconsistent_txt: See folder 1-guidelines > non-checklists > document conflicts_record. Conflict is recorded here.  This journal has 2 different Guidlines:  Wiley: Would be marked Not Mentioned for all above criteria.  APS: As marked above

comment_pub_data: As a signatory to the TOP guidelines, Cortex requires authors to make their anonymised research data publicly available to the maximum permitted by relevant ethical and legal requirements. Research data refers to the results of observations or experimentation that validate research findings.
comment_pub_proc: To facilitate reproducibility and data reuse, this journal also encourages you to share your software, code, models, algorithms, protocols, methods and other useful materials related to the project.
All authors are requested to make sure that all data and materials as well as software application or custom code support their published claims and comply with field standards.

comment_stat_tests: The Results section should describe the most important findings of the study, analysis, or experiment.
comment_outcomes: The Results section should describe the most important findings of the study, analysis, or experiment.   The most important results should be indicated, and relevant trends and patterns should be described.

comment_prereg_trial: A statement confirming that, following IPA, the   authors agree to register their approved protocol   on the Open Science Framework or other   recognized repository, either publicly or under   private embargo until submission of the Stage 2   manuscript.
comment_stat_tests: Detailed information on each analysis performed   is included with specific p values.    The authors must state the statistical methods they have used: descriptive and/or experimental design.
comment_outcomes: The outcomes of confirmatory pre-registered   analyses are, in all cases, clearly distingiushed   from the outcomes of any additional unregistered   analyses.
comment_pval: Detailed information on each analysis performed   is included with specific p values.
comment_exact_p: Authors reporting null hypothesis significance tests are required to report exact p values and effect sizes for all inferential analyses.
comment_precision: Statistical analysis should always include effect sizes and expressions of uncertainty (an interval estimate).
comment_pub_data: Anonymized raw data and digital study materials must be made freely available in a public repository/archive with a link provided within the Stage 2 manuscript.
comment_pub_proc: That the manuscript includes a link to the public   archive containing anonymized study data, digital materials/code and the laboratory log.     New computational neuroscience computer code must be included with the initial submission as Extended Data to ensure reproducibility if published and be deposited in a suitable repository such as GitHub, ModelDB, BioModels, CellML, or Visiome
comment_pub_stat: States: The following resources offer helpful guidelines on how to report statistical results:    citing Curran-Everitt, "The following resources offer helpful guidelines on how to report statistical results:"

comment_stat_tests: We encourage inclusion of complete statistical analyses and full data sets at the individual level, but these should be presented in tables or as Electronic Supplementary Material (ESM).
comment_outcomes: We encourage inclusion of complete statistical analyses and full data sets at the individual level, but these should be presented in tables or as Electronic Supplementary Material (ESM).
comment_pub_data: This journal operates a type 2 research data policy (life sciences). A submission to the journal implies that materials described in the manuscript, including all relevant raw data, will be freely available to any researcher wishing to use them for non-commercial purposes, without breaching participant confidentiality.  The journal strongly encourages that all datasets on which the conclusions of the paper rely should be available to readers. We encourage authors to ensure that their datasets are either deposited in publicly available repositories (where available and appropriate) or presented in the main manuscript or additional supporting files whenever possible.

comment_fig_var: Statistical measures such as SD or SEM should be identified in the headings.
comment_pub_data: EJN expects you to archive all the data from which your published results are derived in a public repository.

comment_prereg_trial: both recommend that clinical trials should be registered prospectively
comment_var: Important descriptive statistics, such as mean and standard deviation  (SD), or standard error of the mean (SEM), need to be either  represented graphically or numerically in the text.
comment_mean: ??Important descriptive statistics, such as mean and standard deviation  (SD), or standard error of the mean (SEM), need to be either  represented graphically or numerically in the text.
comment_pub_data: This journal mandates and peer reviews data sharing
comment_pub_stat: Refers to   Reporting statistical methods and statistical results in EJR  European Journal of Neuroscience, Vol. 28, pp. 2363-2364, 2008    for statistical guidelines

comment_prereg_trial: Only required for prospective clinical trials.   Retrospectively registered trials are still permitted:  For clinical trials that have not been registered prospectively, authors are encouraged to register retrospectively to ensure the complete publication of all results. The trial registration number (TRN), date of registration and the words 'retrospectively registered' should be included as the last line of the manuscript abstract.
comment_pub_data: Data availability statement:  A submission to the journal implies that materials described in the manuscript, including all relevant raw data, will be freely available to any researcher wishing to use them for non-commercial purposes, without breaching participant confidentiality.  E.g. of statement:  1. The datasets generated during and/or analysed during the current study are available in the [NAME] repository, [PERSISTENT WEB LINK TO DATASETS]  2. The datasets generated during and/or analysed during the current study are available from the corresponding author on reasonable request.
inconsistent_txt: The journal's definition of "freely available" data does not necessarily mean "publicly available":  They consider data are freely available if data are provided by corresponding author on reasonable request (see data availability statement excerpts)

comment_prereg_trial: NOTE: If the research study was registered (clause 35 of the Declaration of Helsinki) the registration database should be indicated, else the lack of registration should be noted as an exception (e.g. The study conformed to the standards set by the Declaration of Helsinki, except for registration in a database.);
comment_prereg_other: NOTE: If the research study was registered (clause 35 of the Declaration of Helsinki) the registration database should be indicated, else the lack of registration should be noted as an exception (e.g. The study conformed to the standards set by the Declaration of Helsinki, except for registration in a database.);      Registered Reports are a form of empirical article in which the methods and proposed analyses are pre-registered and reviewed prior to research being conducted.
comment_exclude: Clearly indicate any inclusion or exclusion criteria
comment_missing: Clearly indicate any inclusion or exclusion criteria
comment_var: To characterise a normally distributed sample, report the mean (SD), and the number of samples (n). Use an appropriate number of significant figures. If samples are not normally distributed, use median and quartile values, or transform the data to obtain a more normal distribution. When describing the precision of estimation of a mean value, 95% confidence limits of the mean should be used, rather than the SEM.
comment_mean: To characterise a normally distributed sample, report the mean (SD), and the number of samples (n). Use an appropriate number of significant figures. If samples are not normally distributed, use median and quartile values, or transform the data to obtain a more normal distribution. When describing the precision of estimation of a mean value, 95% confidence limits of the mean should be used, rather than the SEM.
comment_median: To characterise a normally distributed sample, report the mean (SD), and the number of samples (n). Use an appropriate number of significant figures. If samples are not normally distributed, use median and quartile values, or transform the data to obtain a more normal distribution. When describing the precision of estimation of a mean value, 95% confidence limits of the mean should be used, rather than the SEM.
comment_no_sem: To characterise a normally distributed sample, report the mean (SD), and the number of samples (n). Use an appropriate number of significant figures. If samples are not normally distributed, use median and quartile values, or transform the data to obtain a more normal distribution. When describing the precision of estimation of a mean value, 95% confidence limits of the mean should be used, rather than the SEM.
comment_pval: Use the exact P value, to the appropriate number of decimals, particularly when values are near a stated limit. For example, P = 0.051 and P = 0.049 have very similar implications.
comment_exact_p: To characterise a normally distributed sample, report the mean (SD), and the number of samples (n). Use an appropriate number of significant figures. If samples are not normally distributed, use median and quartile values, or transform the data to obtain a more normal distribution. When describing the precision of estimation of a mean value, 95% confidence limits of the mean should be used, rather than the SEM.
comment_precision: To characterise a normally distributed sample, report the mean (SD), and the number of samples (n). Use an appropriate number of significant figures. If samples are not normally distributed, use median and quartile values, or transform the data to obtain a more normal distribution. When describing the precision of estimation of a mean value, 95% confidence limits of the mean should be used, rather than the SEM.
comment_trend: Use the exact P value, to the appropriate number of decimals, particularly when values are near a stated limit. For example, P = 0.051 and P = 0.049 have very similar implications.
comment_fig_raw_data: Where possible, graphs should show individual values, rather than solid bars indicating a mean value. If a plot of individual values obscures some of the data presented, a box and whisker plot can be used to show mean or median, and 95% confidence intervals or quartiles.
comment_pub_data: Please state access codes for data deposition (e.g. protein/DNA/RNA sequences, macromolecular structures) and where relevant, indicate where computer source codes can be obtained.    Experimental Physiology is committed to encouraging the free exchange of scientific information and to promote progress in all areas of physiological research. Experimental Physiology requires, as a condition for publication, that nucleic acid and protein sequences, microarray data and data obtained using high throughput sequencing techniques, which support the results in the paper, should be archived in an appropriate public database (see below) and must be accessible without restriction from the date of publication.    Experimental Physiology requires the provision of a Data Availability Statement for all papers reporting original data, both in the manuscript and in the appropriate field during submission.  The Data Availability Statement should describe the availability of these data. If any data cannot be shared, the reason(s) should also be outlined in this statement. Authors must include in their Statement a link to the repository they have used (if applicable), reference the data in the appropriate sections(s) of their manuscript and cite the data they have shared in the References section. Whenever possible the scripts and other artefacts used to generate the analyses presented in the paper should also be publicly available/archived.   If sharing data compromises ethical standards or legal requirements then authors are not expected to share them, but should note this in their Statement.
comment_pub_proc: Please state access codes for data deposition (e.g. protein/DNA/RNA sequences, macromolecular structures) and where relevant, indicate where computer source codes can be obtained. If sharing data compromises ethical standards or legal requirements then authors are not expected to share them, but should note this in their Statement.

inconsistent_txt: All datasets on which the conclusions of the paper rely must be either deposited in publicly   available repositories...    For all journals, BioMed Central strongly encourages all datasets on which the conclusions of the manuscript rely to be either deposited in publicly available repositories     The recommendation for depositing data sets is inconsistent, some places it states you MUST do it and other places it uses language such as "encourages".

comment_prereg_trial: 'must be registered'  This an Elsevier standard guideline with some minor adjustments.
comment_pub_data: Weak encouragement: standard Elsevier line (see Neuroscience Methods)
comment_pub_proc: Weak encouragement
comment_pub_stat: Weak encouragement

comment_stat_tests: But for figures and legends  'Information reported in figures and legends are required to describe each individual experiment presented, including the number of samples or animals used, the statistical test performed, sex, and any non-uniform adjustments to digital images.'
comment_pub_data: Authors are strongly encouraged to make the data underlying the results presented in the manuscript available to reviewers and readers. Authors should make the data available upon request or store it in appropriate public repositories.    Note the OR in the last sentence may need discussion.  I have given Benefit of doubt to the Journal.
comment_pub_proc: Here is the quote - it only applies to computer simulation.  Given benefit of doubt!  'For manuscripts reporting computer simulation using original, author-generated code, authors are strongly encouraged to deposit software and code via a public repository, such as GitHub.'
comment_pub_stat: Not explicit but see my comment in the next box.
inconsistent_txt: This paragraph is potentially ambivalent:  'Work published in the APS Journals must necessarily be independently verifiable. Authors describing results derived from unique materials, for example: antibodies, recombinant plasmids and cloned DNAs, and mutant cell lines or viruses, are expected to make such materials available to qualified investigators on request. In addition, authors are encouraged to make data that underlie the conclusions reported in the article freely available via public repositories or available to readers upon request.' [How can work be independently verifiable if the authors are only 'encouraged' to make data available?    NOTE it does mention the JAPPL/APS Curran Everett articles under 'Related Editorials and guidelines'  You also get there by clicking to the Rigor and Reproducibility Checklist.    This starts with the following entreaty: Articles published in APS journals must report experimental methods in sufficient detail to allow for transparency of data and replication by others. Authors are highly encouraged to use the Rigor and Reproducibility Checklist when preparing their original research submissions for APS Journals.

Journal name: journal of neuropsychiatry and clinical neurosciences
comment_prereg_trial: strong statement
comment_stat_tests: 'The following information regarding research design should be included: 1) a clearly stated hypothesis, 2) the names of the statistical tests used'
comment_no_sem: 'If error bars are included, standard deviations, rather than standard errors of the mean, should be used.'
comment_pub_stat: comment relevant to guidelines: The document started with 'The requirements stated below are in accordance with the International Committee of Medical Journal Editors. See "Recommendations for the Conduct, Reporting, Editing, and Publication of Scholarly Work in Medical Journals" (icmje.org).'  I took this as a recommended guideline in the set of possibilities.

comment_prereg_trial: Journal no longer takes papers on clinical trials
comment_var: Under TABLES  tables should summarize results by an accepted method of expression, e.g. standard deviation (S.D).
comment_pub_data: ...'This journal encourages and enables you to share data that supports your research publication  where appropriate...
comment_pub_proc: this journal also encourages you to share your software, code, models,  algorithms, protocols, methods and other useful materials related to the project
comment_pub_stat: see above

comment_fig_raw_data: Guidelines stated - Use dotplot overlays if sample size is small.

comment_pub_proc: To facilitate  reproducibility and data reuse, this journal also encourages you to share your software, code, models,  algorithms, protocols, methods and other useful materials related to the project.

comment_fig_raw_data: If n ≤ 30, all data points must be plotted in the figure in a way that reveals their range and distribution. A bar graph with data points overlaid, a box and whisker plot or a violin plot (preferably with data points included) are acceptable formats. If n > 30, then the entire raw dataset must be made available either as supporting information, or hosted on a not-for-profit repository

comment_prereg_trial: Elsevier guidelines

comment_pub_proc: publish algorithms
comment_pub_stat: **Authors are strongly encouraged to use appropriate reporting guidelines (comment for q1)    This includes ICMJE RECOMMENDATIONS PDF -

comment_prereg_trial: All clinical trials must be registered in a public trials registry to be considered for publication, and authors should be compliant with the Consolidated Standards of Reporting Trials (CONSORT).
comment_pub_data: We encourage research data to be archived in data repositories wherever possible.    A submission to the journal implies that materials described in the manuscript, including all relevant raw data, will be freely available to any researcher wishing to use them for non-commercial purposes, without breaching participant confidentiality.  The journal strongly encourages that all datasets on which the conclusions of the paper rely should be available to readers. We encourage authors to ensure that their datasets are either deposited in publicly available repositories (where available and appropriate) or presented in the main manuscript or additional supporting files whenever possible.

comment_prereg_other: This is mandatory for clinical trials and optional for other studies.
comment_outcomes: Provide data on all identified primary and secondary outcomes identified in the Methods section
comment_pval: Journal encourages authors NOT to use p values:    Due to growing concerns on the overuse and misinterpretation of p values, replace p values with estimates of effects or association...unless the protocol or the statistical analysis plan has specified methods to adjust for multiplicity of testing...The analysis of all secondary and other endpoints should focus on estimates and 95% confidence intervals.     When possible, provide absolute rather than relative risks, and include measures of association and estimates of precision rather than simply p values.
comment_trend: The term 'trend'...is not appropriate to use when a finding is 'almost, but not, significant' according to your criteria (such as p<0.05). Please correct the text to more correct wording, such as 'the result was ... but this was not different from ... '.

comment_prereg_other: Cell Press journals support the pre-registration of both clinical trials and analysis plans in curated, public repositories when authors consider it appropriate.
comment_fig_var: For pooled data only: For any figures presenting pooled data, the measures should be defined in the figure legends (for example, "Data are represented as mean ± SEM.").
comment_pub_data: For some data public availability is mandatory, for other types it is encouraged.
comment_pub_proc: any previously unreported custom computer code or algorithm used to generate results that are central to the main conclusions of a paper must be archived in a publicly accessible repository
comment_pub_stat: any previously unreported custom computer code or algorithm used to generate results that are central to the main conclusions of a paper must be archived in a publicly accessible repository

comment_prereg_trial: Note the Guide to Authors is a rather standard guide prepared by Elsevier and we will run in to it elsewhere in our auditing SG
comment_pub_data: This journal encourages and enables you to share data that supports your research publication. Elsevier standard feeble wording
comment_pub_proc: To facilitate reproducibility and data reuse, this journal also encourages you to share your software, code,
comment_pub_stat: Weak statement to share 'methods' Benefit of doubt to journal.  Rather pathetic though!

comment_prereg_other: Authors should indicate in Acknowledgements whether or not the conducted research was preregistered with an analysis plan in an independent, institutional registry.

comment_pub_data: strongly encouraged  encouraged

Diabolical set of guidelines: it is an umbrella set of documents.  You have to find your journal from a list.  But eventually you come to this: 'The preferred mechanism for sharing research data is via data repositories. Authors are encouraged to deposit their research data in a repository'
inconsistent_txt: This was a terrible set of guidelines.  As indicated above it is an umbrella set and it is not easy to work out which requirements apply to Physiological measurement.  An email to the journal did not get a response.

comment_prereg_trial: Registration but not pre-registration required: If clinical trials were used, a statement of registration is required
